column1: apparent  that  the  main  and  the  interim  reliefs  prayed  for  in  the  prayer  of  the
Petition  have  a  direct  impact  on  the  rights  of  the  Development  Officers  in  the
Department, and if the Writs prayed for are issued, such Development Officers will
be  adversely  affected.  Nevertheless,  the  Petitioners  have  failed  to  name  such
Development Officers as parties to the instant application. In Rawaya Publishers and
Others v. Wijedasa Rajapaksha, Chairman, Sri Lanka Press Council and Others (2001)3
SLR 213, it was decided that in the context of a writ application, a necessary party
is one without whom no order can be effectively made, and the Petitioner cannot
be permitted to proceed with an application.
Therefore, I am of the view that without them, no effective order can be made in
this Application, and failure to make them Respondents is fatal to the application.
